para.text: Test Center

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: In KRT software, all the test parameters managing by a test template, you can enter to the test modules from "Test Center" or any single test modules; if enter from single test modules, the default test template will be used.
A template file include the test objects information and all relative test modules and user defined test points.
User can easy create or modify the template.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: On the top of "Test Center" view, displayed the user defined template name, default template has no name.

image.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Menu:

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: File -> New
Add button: Add selected module to the list for performs the testing.
Remove, Clear buttons: Delete one or all modules from the list.
Module list:

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#c0c0c0; border-style:solid;

para.text: Test Wait:

while testing for multiple modules, the testing will preforming one by one, if a module test wait set as Yes, while the performing switch to this new module, test kit will stop injecting and wait for a manual intervention command.
Model name:
alias name of test module for identify the same type modules.
Wiring View:
User can define a wiring instruction photo, it will showing while test wait state.
Wait Hint:
message showing while test wait state.
Rename an exist module alias, or change the "Test Wait", "Wait Hint", or "Wiring View" settings.

anchor.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Save present settings to a template file.
Note:
For test template file safety purpose, all the settings changed during the test will not auto-save to template, user have to save it manually. We suggest user always save to a different file name.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Shortcut button to Activate / Deactivate all the modules in the test center.
